li.a: UPSM Elementary School – Sidney D. Miller Campus

li.class: menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-has-children menu-parent-item menu-item-5831

div.h4: Parent Communications | Confirmed Cases | Parent Questionnaire | Learning Packet Pick-Up | Google Classroom | Student Resources | Contact Information | COVID-19 Prevention & Resources
div.p: On behalf of the faculty and staff at U Prep Schools thank you for your patience and flexibility as we work together to ensure that the needs of our students, families, and community are being met through this crisis.

As information becomes available regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19) and state-mandated school closure, updates will be provided through a variety of communication channels to include; RoboCall, Text Messaging, Email, and this new web page.

This web page will provide you access to previously distributed communications regarding COVID-19, a status on confirmed cases within our three districts, updates regarding the school closure, key contacts, and information on prevention, and resources to help keep our families safe and healthy throughout the crisis.
Please know that information regarding the impact of COVID-19 to our region is changing rapidly and the team at U Prep is committed to keeping you informed of such changes.

Spring Break will take place as normally scheduled, April 6th – 10th. Please be advised that the President of the United States has cancelled all K-12 Standardized Testing for the remainder of this school year, and Governor Whitmer has cancelled in-person instruction for the 2019-20 school year. U Prep teachers and school leaders are prepared to launch our virtual learning for the U Prep community after Spring Break.
Please review the April 3rd Weekly Communication for details about what to expect when we reopen enrichment learning activities on April 13th.

li.a: UPA Continuity of Learning and COVID-19 Response Plan
UPAD Continuity of Learning and COVID-19 Response Plan
UPSM Continuity of Learning and COVID-19 Response Plan
Letter from the CEO – After School Activities Cancelled

div.p: Click here to join us, in tribute, as we remember the lives lost in the U Prep Community.
As of April 21, 2020, 11 cases of COVID-19 have been confirmed in the U Prep community.

If you experience any symptoms of the COVID-19 virus, please call your healthcare provider for medical advice, reach out to the Detroit Health Department at (313) 876-4000 for guidance or visit the Center for Disease Control (CDC) website at https://www.cdc.gov/.
Please visit this site to receive additional updates concerning COVID-19.

Each campus prepared printed learning packets that will be available for pick up on Tuesday, March 17th and Wednesday, March 18th from 7 am – 11 am and again from 2 pm – 6 pm for all U Prep school districts.
Learning Packets that were not picked up have been mailed home. If you don’t receive your child’s packet, please notify your child’s teacher and they can provide them to you electronically.

Please be sure to share any good news that is happening with your scholar in his/her home school environment so we can share it with the U Prep Community on our social media platforms or perhaps in a future e-newsletter.

Teachers are using a variety of web platforms to interact with families. Google Classroom, Remind Me, Bloomz and others. They will be available during the hours of 8:30 am – 3:30 pm daily. Please allow at minimum a 30-45 minute response to ensure each scholar is assisted appropriately. We will continue to learn ways to engage with students as we progress.

If you are having any technical challenges, contact Leandra Baker, IT Coordinator, via email at servicedesk@uprepschools.com. Please make certain you state your problem and leave your contact information. Click here to view the Google Classroom instructions and IT support instructions. Click here to view the Parent resource letter.

The health and well being of our families is of our utmost concern. We are working to finalize the details for the weeks ahead of our meal distribution program with our supplier Variety Foods. Updates to our program will be provided to our families via Robocall, Email, and will be posted below.

This week’s Meal Distribution will take place tomorrow, Tuesday, April 14, 2020 at UPA High School, located at 600 Antoinette. Pick up will begin at 12 noon. Please arrive early, as meals will be distributed on a fist-come, first-served basis. Each family will receive five breakfasts and five lunches per child. Our staff will ensure that this process is quick and convenient for all families.

Telecommuting and homeschooling are new to many of us. The combination of both can provide a challenge for families with multiple children of various ages and let’s not forget our beloved pets. There are some great suggestions online on how to convert your home into both a classroom and an office. Attached is a link to some suggestions on How to Adjust to Working Remotely with Kids During COVID-19 and How to Create a Learning Environment in the Home.

U Prep Schools is grateful to Ascension Michigan School-Based Health Centers who have locations inside of two of our schools, for offering virtual medical and mental health services to students at UPSM Elementary and UPA Middle Schools. The services are available Monday-Friday, from 10am until 3pm.

To access medical services, contact Nurse Practitioner, Sheiraz Tekko at (313) 264-6611 or via email at sheiraz.tekko@ascension.org. For mental health services, contact Behavioral Health Counselor, Heather Murphy at heather.murphy2@ascension.org.
Parents, please be advised – you will need to provide verbal or written consent to access services for your child.
Our school social workers have also assembled a list of valuable resources that are available to our families during this challenging time.
Click below for recommendations from Athletic Director, Andre Criswell. He has provided helpful tips on keeping your family active during the school closure.
A brief questionnaire was sent via email to all parents on Thursday, March 12th to help us identify the number of families who do not have internet, computer, printer, or mobile phone access.
This information is vital as we want to ensure that all families receive important updates regarding the COVID-19 virus and lesson plans during the school closure.

If you have not yet completed it please do so as soon as possible so we can gauge the technological needs of our families. Please contact your School Operations Manager if you did not receive a survey and one will be emailed to you.

The best defense against any contagious illness is frequent and effective handwashing and seeking immediate medical assistance if experiencing symptoms. Below are recommendations that we included in our letters to families and staff.

ul.li: Washing your hands with soap and water.
Avoiding touching your eyes, nose or mouth with unwashed hands.
Covering your mouth and nose with a tissue or upper sleeve when coughing or sneezing.
Avoiding contact with people who are sick.
Staying home if you are sick and contact your healthcare provider.
Please refer to the links below for the most current information on taking precautions, symptoms, and situation updates.

p.strong: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services – Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

ul.li: CDC Talking With Your Child about COVID-19: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/community/schools-childcare/talking-with-children.html

p.strong: Michigan Department of Health and Human Services (MDHHS) Resources and Links

ul.li: MDHHS COVID-19 Link for Childcare & School Administrators: https://www.michigan.gov/coronavirus/0,9753,7-406-98178_98157—,00.html
General questions about the outbreak, please call 313-876-4000 or email us at dhdoutbreak@detroitmi.gov
